4/4: @NRDems will be discussing efforts to revise PROMESA in the near future. Certain necessary conversations, including about the island’s long-term status, cannot happen as long as the Rosselló crisis remains in the background.

3/4: This is an opportunity for the federal government to work closely with municipalities and Puerto Rico’s civil society to achieve meaningful reconstruction. As Chair of @NRDEMS, I remain committed to helping improve the lives and futures of families on the island.

2/4: Congress and the Trump administration must not use this crisis of governance to slow or reduce federal aid, and the control board should not attempt to amass more unelected power over the day-to-day lives of the people of Puerto Rico.

1/4: The people of Puerto Rico are speaking loud and clear and demanding accountability from elected officials for this alleged corruption and shameful behavior. It is clear that Rosselló should resign.
